item.title: Getting started...patcher won't start up right
item.dc:creator: @DrGwon Steve Fernandez
item.description:
@DrGwon wrote:

Hello im brand new with axoloti and I can't start the patcher. I download the runtime and then installed it and then download the app and doble click the app package and installed into applications folder (I just follow the instructions on installing post).
all looks good and in the right folder to me. BUT when I open the APP the only window I can see its the "console" no patcher and no file or preference or any option just AXOLOTI appears at the top bar.
console doesn't advice any ERROR message(connected its on red)
im running Mac OS 10.13.
what can't I do to open the patcher?
im pretty sure there is something really obvious im missing but can't find the problem.
(Please excuse my poor English ,,I hope you can understand it).

item.title: Installing on Mac OS X
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

macOS Catalina is NOT supported at this time.

(we are looking into compatibility issues at this time, and do not have a timeframe on resolving this yet)

Normal Installation

To reduce size we split the application into two parts, the main axoloti application, and a runtime which contains other required files. You must download and install both initially.
(Usually updates will only require the main application to be downloaded and installed.)

  1. download both application bundle and axoloti_runtime
    • go to http://github.com/axoloti/axoloti/releases, you will see the 'latest release'
    • download axo_runtime_osx_(version).dmg
    • download axoloti_osx_(version).dmg
  2. install axoloti runtime:
    • open axo_runtime_osx_(version).dmg
    • drag the axoloti_runtime folder to /Applications
    • you will now have a folder /Applications/axoloti_runtime/platform_osx
  3. install application:
    • double clicking on package
    • drag Axoloti app to Applications
  4. Connect Axoloti Core board
  5. Run Axoloti application in Applications folder

Thats it your done,
Happy patching

Recommended Platform

Axoloti runs on many platforms and variations, but we are only able to test on limited number of platforms, if you experience issues we recommend the following, as these are our test platforms.

  • Mac OS X 10.10.3+
  • Java 1.8

*recommended java version is 1.8 from https://java.com/en/download/

Developer installation (from source)

If you are a developer and would like to follow the most up to date developments, and perhaps contribute to Axoloti development you can install from the Axoloti github repo

if you are running Mac OSX 10.11+ (El Capitan) you will need to install a Java JDK, you should use the Oracle install, JDK 1.8. this needs to be done 'manually' as Oracle require you to accept their license. you will also need to install ant, and ensure it is on your path.

  • clone from github
  • run build.sh in platform_macosx
  • run ./Axoloti.sh

Note: to create the bundles you will need to install the Oracle Java 8 JDK

Note: Mac OS 10.11 (El Capitan) should work, but is currently not fully tested, please report any issue on the helpdesk thread.

Posts: 8

Participants: 3

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti Patcher
item.dc:creator: @Eduard Eduard
item.description:
@Eduard wrote:

Hi guys, I have this really strange bug, whenever I connect to wifi or internet my .pref file gets deleted and replaced with the stock one. I have also noticed whenever I am in LIVE mode and try to change a parameter it works but if I am offline I get the following error:

Axoloti version : 1.0.12-2-0-g7975cc87 build time : 09/04/2018 13:15:31 GMT
Link to firmware CRC E95BAC96
Status: factory (1.0.12,anon) : OK ( 1.0.12,clean )

Status: community (1.0.12,anon) : OK ( 1.0.12,clean )

connected

finished loading objects

Done uploading patch

Done starting patch

I have tried reinstalling the patcher, I believe its a software issue or an issue with my Mac as I get the same error with my 2nd board. Any help will be much appreciated and thank you in advance.

item.title: Mac OS Sierra and Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

has anyone tested Axoloti on Sierra yet?

I have not, and I will not be able to for the foreseeable future, as I have some hardware/software that is allegedly not working yet on Sierra,
so I need my MBP and iMac both to remain on 10.11.6 for now. - so I will not be upgrading yet.
Ive now upgraded my MBP to Sierra (10.12.0), see below for results
I do realise however, that good things are being said about Sierra vs El Capitan, so will be upgrading as soon as the software/hardware I use, gives the all clear

What does this mean for users?

Whilst I wouldn't expect problems, until there is a developer in a position to upgrade, we wont be able to resolve any issues that do arise on Sierra. so I would not recommend upgrading at this time.

(generally, its work with Mac OS waiting for the dot maintenance releases before upgrading e.g. 10.12.1 or 2)

IF someone does upgrade, can you please use this thread, to post your experiences.
e.g. does it work? what issues to you face?
(please be very careful they are really Sierra issues i.e. they don't occur on 10.11.6)

Note: DAWs, Plugns and other Hardware manufactures are reporting issues, so you would be advised to check all your software/hardware before attempting an upgrade.

Testing Status:
so I upgrade my MBP, here's where I'm at so far, testing is NOT complete, so upgrade at your own risk

Tested with: MBP / 10.12.0 / Axoloti 1.0.11
Overall: No issues encountered so far
Tested: (generally quite limited)
- Axoloti Firmware upload - ok
- Axoloti UI - compile, upload, run patch, adjust parameters - ok
- Axoloti Patch Editing - move objects, delete, move wires, add objects - ok
- Axoloti Libraries - sync , see objects - ok
- Axoloti Object editor - seems ok, but not done any read editing yet.
- CPU - appears to be same as 10.11, as far as i can tell.

so overall, with limited testing, Sierra does not appear to have introduced any new issues. of course more testing is required... and also for longer 'sessions'

Posts: 8
